hypothesis_content.title: Political Memecoin Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/BULL regimes with elevated social volume around political events (e.g., elections, debates), a significant compression in the 7-day realized volatility of political memecoins (e.g., TRUMP, BODEN) below their 30-day 20th percentile, followed by a +5% move in BTC, will trigger a sharp volatility expansion in those memecoins, outperforming generic memecoins.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Political memecoins trade on narrative and attention, which is currently high per news cycle. During calm markets, they can become dormant. A sharp move in BTC shakes out complacency and redirects speculative capital. Political narratives provide a focused channel for that capital, causing outsized moves in these low-float, high-narrative tokens.
entry_conditions: 7-day realized volatility for 'political memecoin basket' < its 30-day 20th percentile (vol compression)
BTC rallies +5% within a 12-hour window (volatility catalyst)
Social mentions for relevant political keywords (e.g., 'election', 'debate') 24h avg > 30-day avg

exit_conditions.take_profit: Political memecoin basket 24h realized volatility expands to > 30-day 80th percentile
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC gives back its +5% gain and trades below entry-level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: BTC volatility fails to translate into altcoin volatility. Speculative capital flows into other narrative sectors (AI, DePIN, RWA) instead of memecoins. Political memecoins remain illiquid and unresponsive.
